summary: Palestine is a country in West Asia, recognized by many countries. It includes the West Bank and Gaza Strip, which are controlled by Israel and known as the Occupied Palestinian Territories. Palestine has a long history with many rulers. The Israeli-Palestinian conflict started with Jewish immigration and British rule. After World War I, the United Nations planned to divide the land, but a war broke out. Israel was established in 1948, and in 1967, Israel took over the West Bank and Gaza. Palestine declared independence in 1988 and has limited rule in these areas. The country faces challenges like Israeli settlements and violence. Palestine is mostly Muslim, speaks Arabic, and is part of international groups like the United Nations.
title: State of Palestine
